The organizations are hoping to bring the people together in celebration of community, nature and the joy...

entry.title: Business Champions for Kids recognizes local employers

The local employers are being recognized through the “Best Place for Working Parents” initiative, which enables employers to determine how their organization fares on...

entry.title: Sunday fire destroys structure on West Military
entry.summary: Jan. 2, 2024 6:45 a.m. Douglas County Fire District No. 2 responded to a structure fire early Sunday morning in Roseburg. According to a press release, fire crews were dispatched just after 4 a.m. to a residence on West Military Avenue. Crews reportedly found a medium sized shop that was fully involved and threatening other...

entry.title: Registration Open for Mushroom Growing Class from OSU Extension
entry.summary: 1/2/2024 11:10 Registration is open for a popular mushroom growing class hosted by the Oregon State University Douglas County Extension Service. “Growing Your Own Mushrooms” will be held Saturday, March 2nd, at River Forks Park from 12:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m. The class is described as an introduction to growing mushrooms through a hands-on workshop...

entry.title: Shop lost in Sunday fire
entry.summary: A shop and all of its contents were lost and a trailer sustained heat damage from a structure fire Sunday morning.

entry.title: W. Military Structure Fire (Photo)
entry.summary: At 04:06 am Sunday morning, 12/31/23, Douglas County Fire District No.2 responded to a reported possible structure fire on West Military Avenue in Roseburg. The first arriving fire crew reported a medium size shop that was fully involved with other structures threatened. A camp trailer parked nearby suffered minor heat damage, the shop and all its contents were a total loss. The cause of the fire is undetermined due to the extent of damage, but it’s believed the fire started from a possible electrical issue from a nearby chicken coop. DCFD No.2 responded with 3 fire engines, 1 water tender and 1 Command vehicle, Fire Crews were assisted by Lookingglass Fire department, DCSO, Roseburg PD, and PP&L.

entry.title: Forestland owners adapt to new forestry rules
entry.summary: Small forestland owners across the state find themselves in the midst of realizing that with 2024 approaching, changes will have to be made on their lands to comply with the new Private Forest Accord laws coming into effect Monday.
